boat.name: Lily
boat.full_description:
‘Lily’ was launched August 2002 and based at Stone Sailing Club on the River Blackwater until 2015. She is a classic full length keel gaff cutter, 28’ long, 9’ beam, 6’ headroom in the saloon. Her lines were taken from the East Coast oyster smack ‘Secret’ and modified for a 28 hp Vetus diesel engine. She has a fibreglass hull, her main structure is opepe with topworks in iroko.

Lily owned by Peter Herbert is a 28ft Essex Smack Yacht drawing close to 6 tons. Her lines were taken off a working oyster smack out of Colchester, named 'Secret', by a Faversham boatbuilder, John Tyrell. Having built several complete boats, Tyrell sold the hull mould to International Marine Designs based in North Wales.

Further boats were then built by a boatyard based in Norfolk named Marsham. Peter Herbert purchased the hull in 1998 and fitted her out over a period of three years including the wooden spars.
boat.construction_details: GRP hull deck and outfit wood
boat.short_description: Fitted out by her owner from new between 1998 and 2002, 'Lily' is the first boat from a Tyrell & Young mould to be fitted with racing rig.

for_sales.sales_text: `Lily’, a demanding lady, is looking for a younger, more agile owner to satisfy her desire for further adventures. Launched 2002, classic full length keel gaff cutter, 28’ long, 9’ beam, 6’ headroom in saloon. Lines from EC oyster smack `Secret’, modified for 28 hp Vetus diesel engine. Fibreglass hull, main structure opepe, topworks iroko. Lloyds Design Certification, licenced for six crew. Single & double berth in bow, double in saloon, pilot berth aft. Separate heads: shower, washbasin & holding tank. Comprehensive 230v/12v system (4 batteries), pumped hot and cold water, diesel heater, fridge, gas hob, 230 volt microwave. Yeoman Plotter, GPS navigation, autohelm, radio, Navtex weather unit. Laid up ashore River Blackwater, Essex under full length canopy.
for_sales.summary: `Lily’, a demanding lady, is looking for a younger, more agile owner to satisfy her desire for further adventures. Launched 2002, classic full length keel gaff cutter, 28’ long, 9’ beam, 6’ headroom in saloon. Lines from EC oyster smack `Secret’, modified for 28 hp Vetus diesel engine.
